args:
Leonidas apologizes to the mob and promises
to distribute both supplies and compensation,
which leads them to back down. He then tells
his brother about the rumors and announces the
appearance of a void dragon before leaving his
younger sibling to deal with the mess.
What are you doing here, Brother?!
It's Prince Leonidas, eldest of the royals!\nBut what is that weapon he wields?
Do not be concerned, good people.\nI use this to attract your attention only;\nI swear no harm shall come to you.

Now heed me well: Despite what you have
heard, this man is not the Other. That fell
beast has departed this world, and taken
the threat he posed with him.

Additionally, your land of Alberia no longer
suffers under the Dyrenell Empire's rule.
Instead, she is to be stewarded by the
royal family once more.
These words come straight from the royal\nfamily itself; any other reports you may\nencounter are naught but base gossip.
Hmph. You think we're fool enough to\nblithely accept the words of the Other's\nown flesh and blood?
You do not believe me, then?
Th-that's right! I don't! And just what are\nyou gonna do about it, huh?!
This is reasonable. Having subordinated\nourselves to both Dyrenell and the Other,\nwe have lost the trust of the people.

On behalf of the royal family, permit me
to offer my most sincere apologies for
threatening the livelihoods of you good
people and plunging the land into chaos.
You think some pretty words will make\neverything better? What about our crops?\nOur homes? Our FAMILIES?!
Unless I can bake your apology into a pie,\nit's of no use to me!

I understand your struggles, good people,
and have already undertaken measures
to allay them as best I can. ...You there.
How go the preparations?

Sire, we've completed provisioning food
and water per your instructions, and have
already begun distributing it to towns and
villages throughout Alberia.

The royal family will compensate all of you
for your lost homes and fields. And while
we cannot bring back the dead, I promise
solatium and proper burials for all.

In addition, we will see that patrols and
protections are strengthened in the towns
and highways so you might avoid any
further damage from fiends or dragons.

My word is oak. But if it helps assuage
your fears, I have here a written pledge
outlining all I have claimed this day and
signed in my own hand.
Listen well, citizens! As of this moment,\nthe door to the royal family is open to all,\nat any time and for any purpose!
If you would make any further appeal\nor complaint, do not hesitate to come\nspeak with me directly.

I ask only that you cease spreading these
groundless rumors. If you wish to assert
that my brother is the Other, you must first
come before me and prove it.
Well? Should we go back to town and\naccept his supplies and money?
W-wait, you guys are leaving? Dammit...\nWell, it won't go well for you if you renege\non your word, Prince! Remember that!
Remarkable that he brought an end to\nthe uprising AND managed to distribute\nsupplies in such a short time.
I always thought he was a self-centered\ncad, but this is some stand-up action\nright here.
I don't know how to thank you, Leonidas.\nIf you hadn't come, I'd be...
Save your words; I've done no more than\nquell the present turmoil. The people still\nlook upon you with great suspicion.

The fire of that suspicion will doubtless
spark anew if you don't cut off the rumor
at the source. You must find the persons
responsible and deal with them harshly.
Then Ciella was right! Someone spreads\nfoul tales from the shadows!

Also, I would suggest you deal with the
void dragon before it attacks another
village and undoes all the goodwill
I have earned for us this day.
I shall keep watch here for the nonce and\nensure the supplies are distributed without\nincident.
Once you have dealt with your situations,\nthere is a matter I must discuss with you.
Then it wasn't just random chance\nthat brought you out this way.
I leave naught to chance, dear brother.\nI thought you would know that by now.\n...Right then, men. Move out!
We do just what Leonidas suggested:\nWe find the person spreading the rumors,\nand also take care of the void dragon.
Isn't that rather a lot to pile on our plates\nat the same time, darling?
Yes, but time is simply too short to do\nanything else. We have to split up into two\ngroups and tackle them simultaneously.
I would ask you leave the investigation\nof these scurrilous rumors to me.
I cannot claim to have a firm idea yet,\nbut there is something I wish to look into.
If you want to go, I won't stop you—\nbut is it really something you can handle\nall by yourself?
I need no aid in this matter, Highness;\nI shall clear the blemish upon my name\nand prove my worth to you once more!
...All right.\nGo to it—and best of luck to you.
Thank you, Your Highness.\nPray remain on guard.\nI shall see you again anon.
Is she going to be all right?
I'm sure of it. A lot's happened,\nbut I've never seen her fail before,\nand I doubt she'll start now.
As for the rest of us, we're off to track\ndown the void dragon!
